r_c6QmhjUS_Q46iRwCK0lQ.text: The pub was charming, yet the food was not very good. The macaroni and cheese was mostly greasy cheese, I think we found 3 overcooked noodles inside. The fish n chips was okay... Nothing special. We liked the tiny doors and the garden outdoor area in the back.

ba2UWEFyuiOWmEaTMajMbw.text: The roast here is to die for, really. Great place, lovely meals and attentive stuff. DEfinitely recommended.

KtH-JAj9-OS5m5b4YREyAA.text: Definitely the best Sunday roast lunch in Notting Hill, if not all of London. Easily on par with some of the best country pubs... The food, the ales, and the ambiance are all stellar.

photos.caption: Photo of The Windsor Castle - London, United Kingdom

IcPkghFtJ5izaGITPyIDxA.text: This place is not tourist friendly.  my husband and i walked in and about 95% of the empty tables were reserved.  The unreserved tables had patrons sitting with drinks.  we waited 15 minutes at the bar for a staff to acknowledge us.  There were 4 employees and they were too busy chatting with each other. When an employee finally wanted to know what we wanted rudely, we decided to leave and find another place that would appreciate our business.  I chose this pub based on the yelp reviews but I will definitely do more research on other websites since they did not rate so well on those websites before choosing a place.

nchK6WJrfKEzPrq2j5epKg.text: My favourite pub in London. The tiny doors are charming, and there's enough lore on the walls to occupy many a history buff. It's cosy and homey, with a spacious beer garden that is even lovely in the wintertime, as they get the fires going and put out blankets. Sign up for their email newsletter, they often have free drink deals.

2Y2v6S5CpJrYojw91l4E0w.text: This place is the most authentic dining/drinking expererience I have had in London. As an American student studying in London, touristy and overpriced 'pubs' have been common. My dad had headr about this place from a friend and we went when he came to visit- we both loved it so much that we went back the next night! Everything about this place is authentic, quirky, and lovely; from the quintessentially English dishes to the oddly tiny doorways scattered throughout the first floor. HIGHLY recommend!

Nstqw2f5r8Bo3lSFGxhdBA.text: Friendly helpful staff. Great atmosphere. Good food. I had the lamb shoulder and it was great.

EdIgZZnCxmS7QnHnABwAug.text: Hands down, my favorite pub on the planet.  Can't beat it on a warm evening.  The beer garden rocks. Arrive early and put down roots!

PR7SUoVmodS0MOhUAwEPwA.text: Excellent pub. Very nice building, beautiful beer garden, delicious Sunday roast... and they had an IPA festival the day I went!

vVnGPMy0UKUFOtt_0ygLqg.text: Having read most of the reviews below I must agree that the food here is proper english pub food and of great quality, the drinks are also very good. I do however have a couple of axes (only toy plastic ones) to grind, or should I say doors to slam. First of all the there are 2 or 3 doors in the actual pub which have been designed for hobbits rather than humans, now I know full well that this was done on purpose in some attempt at 'cool' but personally I just find it bloody annoying when carrying a round of drinks. The second door which annoys me is the gents toilet door as you end up clubbing it into the body of poor unsuspecting handwashers. Doors aside though, this is a tres bon boozer!

X69rYuHCXxua0DDCfxvqpQ.text: I absolutely loved this place. Authentic old-style English pub with lots of wood, great little side rooms, and doorways where you need to duck through.  They have an awesome beer and ale offering and the beer garden in the back ROCKS.  Chips came with lots of vinegar too.  Loved it and can't wait to go back.

DtrunT_JcIgBArUCAxWh-g.text: This is one of my favorite pubs so far in London (definitely in my top 3)!!!!  It helps that it's only a few minutes away from my flat too.  The atmosphere is great, love the outdoor seating option (equipped with heaters!), good beer, and their gourmet burgers are excellent.  I've been a few times now, and the servers and bartenders have always been very polite.  I definitely plan on making this my regular pub of choice.

HIg80mUrIxIac44PU0d-7A.text: Decent pub. Stopped in here once on a rainy afternoon. Decor is classic English pub - low ceilings, tons of  wood paneling, an all around cosy feel. The beer selection is average and the prices were just touch above average. Nothing here to really shout about, but nothing to complain about, either.

xefWyY7h11BELlNW7vcxMw.text: Really delicious meat pie and fish n chips. Good beer! Must check out!

e5W9__8IxPygF0qtfSbq7w.text: With a large tree-canopied beer garden and a kitchen serving up delicious sausages, the Windsor Castle is a hot ticket on summer days and nights (less so in the winter, but there are heat lamps and atmospheric fairy lights).  Its real charm, however, lies inside the minute historic pub which is comprised of just a few interconnecting rooms (harkening back to a time when drinking citizens were separated by class) and tables.  The dark, all-wood interior is a bit claustrophobic when the weather is nice, but the open fires and soft candlelight create an intimate space on cold nights - perfect for cosying up to loved ones.  Service can be spotty, especially in the garden, and it's quite difficult to get drinks when the pub is crowded.

photos.caption: Photo of The Windsor Castle - London, United Kingdom. www.windsorcastlepub.co.uk

IPTpCc-sXEQgfC7Pgik0bg.text: A good example of a suburban London pub. Like a reviewer below I used to work in an office 50ft away, and probably most of the people who drink in there in the evenings, live around there! Its got a small but nice terraced beer garden, and they also open an outside bar on summer evenings - it can get really busy with people on their way home etc.Would definitely go back there again if in the area.

S16-p8Az_c_C2wA5FPWN9w.text: The lovely Windsor Castle in fashionable Kensignton and Chelsea dates back to 1835 and was a pub frequented by farmers who used to bring their animals to sell in the local market in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of The Windsor Castle - London, United Kingdom. windsor

XqqUWdkqqbE2tv0DosyMrA.text: This pub has been 50ft from my office and it's taken me 2 months to actually stick my head in. I'm an idiot for waiting so long. One thing I'm learning is that it's quite hard to find actual pub grub these days. Y'know, the classics, not this gastro pub stuff which is great but sometimes you hanker for good ol' pub food. Well the Windsor Castle has got pub food down. Fish and Chips, Shepherds Pie, Ploughmans - they're all there and in great form. Reasonable service, cozy atmosphere, good drinks list. This will be my default "real english food" destination in the future.

hFlUpzcHu_x9QYWXYtguQg.text: Charming. Inside and out, a great place to stop for a drink. Inside, a unique interior, mind your head going through the doorways! Outside a great beer garden, like Rebecca O. said, a secret hideaway. And you can trust them to serve you a proper pint.

VfJl-A7YGOwAFP0KFjXRzA.text: The reviews are right. This is the pub of your dreams. With one phone call I was able to surprise my my daughter and husband with a special holiday dinner.They had a reservation at the Castle. After calling Suzanne, the manager she accepted my card over the phone. From Colorado... We received a picture of every course. The food looked delicious. This fact was confirmed by the diners. They commented that they were still full the next day. the food and service was amazingI can not wait to visit when i visit them.

BA5hN7UvmwkyYy3zvNiV6Q.text: So the food was delicious, I loved everything I got and my mom loved everything she got. The place is really cute and nice but the one huge problem is how terrible the service is. Walked into the place and stood there for awhile while the people behind the bar just looked at us and didn't greet us or say hi or explain if we seat ourself or need to wait to be seated, finally had to ask and they said to sit where ever so we did and then waited a good 15 minutes and no one showed up to our table. Had to get up and find someone to take our order. Then we order drinks and food and about 5 minutes later they came back to make sure they got the order right. Then after another 10 minutes with no drinks brought to us I had to get up and go to the bar and ask for my drinks again. Got the food before the drinks. And never saw another waiter or server again after that. Such terrible service, really ruined the whole experience even though the food was good. Will never return

bzXj9NGkqdVNTJ1MlaeLtw.text: The Windsor Castle is a classic pub. Unfortunately it's quite small and get too busy, so early booking is preferable. Otherwise the place offers a very good selection of beer and great atmosphere.

ISdLuW4iwcgCZqv4cYSzMQ.text: What a great pub!  The food is amazing and the beer garden area is awesome.  I went there on a friends recommendation and was quite impressed from the moment I walked in the door.  I walked up to the front bar to order some food and a pint and was met by some very friendly staff.  I placed my order, grabbed my pint and went over a table near by.  When my food came, it wasn't what I had ordered, but the guy dropping it off was so excited by what he was bringing me I thought..."I have to try this"  and it was amazing!  There is a GREAT beer garden in the back area of the pub which is great if you are with a few people, but not so great when you are rolling solo, since most ppl are already in their own little clicks.  I will definitely be hitting this place up again soon!

GEL9Ds_7inAIHRPRVWPS0g.text: lovely lovely pub with a great beer garden.    Food is average but it has a great atmosphere which is added to with authentic dark wood interiors and low doors to walk through.  A nice gem in the middle of Notting Hill suburbia. Worth a stopover.Enjoyx

EV42_XDLiHCoa9i8hVafvw.text: Discovered this place because of yelp. Indeed, the back yard is great and sunny. The Sunday roast is fresh and served quickly. Really enjoyed it. A bit pricey, though.

qMeu0WPSsrk9Ep2abnPlAg.text: free house, dog friendly, fantastic patio, indoor/outdoor bar and gastropub menu.  located in a burbs area, super duper quiet and unassuming. definitely a youngish kensington/nh crowd and expats. the patio was filled to the brim on this summer's day.  but fear not, it was covered with umbrellas and thick ivy with potted herbs on each table...it could be anyone's home garden.beer selection on tap consisted of british, european and american beers including sierra nevada, brooklyn lager, hoegaarden, weiss, leffe and rotating british casks plus 6+ ciders.

F2HcO-YOPrXhh0upmfsVMQ.text: Very cosy pub - wooden interior and the traditional style left well alone. They have the biggest selection of ciders I've ever seen! They even had Sierra Nevada for our cousins. Food selection was good - I can vouch for the healtheir option of halumi salad. I organised a group drinks for 50 people but they would only allow a booking of 30 people. Consequently we spilled out into the street! The place is a great choice to bring overseas visitors for that truly British experience.There is a decent outside garden too.

qY2Pq5KJK5GsQJD8PW8Rbw.text: A charming traditional London pub! If you're looking for quaint authenticity, this place has it. Wonderful atmosphere, plus great beer and a delicious cheeseburger. It was my favorite pub I visited while in London (and I visited quite a few!)

uV09tSlGAU4Nlzp3168crA.text: This is a pub that doesn't look anything like a castle, but you gotta love it anyway. Right around the corner from Madonna's (former) dwelling place in Kensington, locals and non-locals are loyal to this place.  As one Yelper already noted, the interior is a charming challenge: you may need to step over and duck under at the same time.  And the garden patio is a surprise - a pleasant one.  While this is not a "pucker" gastro pub, the pub food here is pretty good (fish and chips, etc.). And the beer, of course, is excellent. Great people-watching, too. Warning: You will hear a lot of American accents, probably because so many of them live in Kensington and Holland Park.

e1oQb31IclOejnJUYracmw.text: Nice outdoor patio, good fish and chips and beef pie.

t76W7kJou6Xq8wIlrWAifg.text: The food was amazing, but even better was the service. Always helpful and friendly, i will certainly be going back again.

2FWek4ArWO4-hJb6o8c-_g.text: A lovely backstreet pub in Notting Hill with a very cute interior - anybody over 5 foot might struggle to get through the internal days between bars. But that cosiness just adds to the charm of the place. And if being cooped up inside isn't your thing, there's a very large beer garden - perfect for both summer and winter. I've visited twice now and both times the food's been decent (and the fact that most people were eating on a Saturday night is a good sign) with a good mix of pub classics. It's not award-winning but it fills you up. Also, if you like your scrumpy, there's three different traditional ciders on tap, plus a good range of ales. Cider lovers would be well-advised to stop by. Ok, so the clientele can be a bit trendy (this is Notting Hill. What do you expect?) but find yourself a corner, grab yourself a cider from the friendly bar staff, and you can happily waste many an hour in a lovely pub world.

fgEwG88R9Lbwm32s_kFOyA.text: A really gorgeous, ye olde worlde pub - lots of nooks and crannies to get lost in, and perfect for a sweet sherry on a winter's day.

ajw67tgVFXc9W3vTmoHHBA.text: Great place to stop in for some Ale and a good meal. Every time I have been there I have had good service. The meals are reasonably priced with a good set of food options. It has a nice outdoor beer garden. Great location right outside of Clapham Junction. Perfect place I you have some time to kill before hopping on a train somewhere.

HHh4hHyk6CFo7NTcB-5DPA.text: Now that the traditional pub has been taken over by corporations and turned into the English version of TGI Friday's, places like Windsor Castle aren't just welcome -- they're important.  This place has plenty of character and quirks. But, most importantly, the food is as good as pub food can get.  The fish and chips are perfect, and the roast I had was generous, with great side veggies and the best horseradish sauce I've ever had.

u_eQwRMh2VQzYSg7KwRB3Q.text: On a warm evening like tonight, there is nothing better than finding a spacious patio where you can gather with friends and enjoy a drink or two.  Places like this are surprisingly few and far between in London, or rather each one is like a secret hideaway.  Once you find one, it's like a magic discovery that you don't want to share.  The Windsor Castle is just this sort of place.  Set a few blocks off of Nottinghill Gate, it is a surprising pub full of small rooms separated by short doors that you must duck to get through (it becomes more skill-testing as the night wears on, almost like an obstacle course for the inebriated).  The back patio is where it's at - lots of room, an outside bar, and lit by lovely tea lights.   I could have stayed for hours... oh wait, I did.

odjXsERJ97jC57v_xFGoLw.text: Hands down my favorite pub in London, I'd even go so far as to say top 5 favorite place in London - all down a quiet street in Notting Hill. It would not be odd for my friends and I to visit Windsor Castle multiple times in the same week - it is everything you could want and more. Pure happiness. Heavenly, outdoor beer garden complete with a beautifully wise, old tree? Yes. Outstanding beer-battered fish and chips? Oh, mmhmm.. yep. Sticky toffee pudding?  God, yes. Sorry, I'll take a moment.Nothing was better than sitting outside, drinking beer and for some, the occasional ciggy, with a group of your best friends around the outdoor heaters. Seating can be rough when it's crowded but I promise you, it is worth hours of fun.The word charming almost seems an injustice to this place. The pub itself is steeped in history: it dates back to something like the 1800s, the interior pub is all dark, worn-in wood, there are candles and lit fireplaces everywhere and as Robin S mentioned, there are still TINY door partitions to navigate through. For me, this is pub perfection and it's what I hold all other pubs to.

2u_vNyYfWCFKDYFq0ByN_Q.text: The interior is charming and, for me, quintessentially London.  The outdoor beer garden however, is what sets Windsor Castle apart.  I owe an enormous debt of gratitude to the individual who directed me here.  Many a Spring (and some Winter) evenings were spent basking in the heat lamps enjoying superior pub fare and pint after pint.  Let us not forget the many afternoons spent shaded under the aforementioned canopy.At it's best this place is bustling and the air is ripe with friendly banter.  At it's worst it is packed making difficult to get to the bar, slip through the minuscule passages, or find real estate out back.  This being said, I will take this place at its worst over most anywhere else!

XpkUB1DjipJCz7AwrVpA7A.text: Such a charming little pub with a nice, shady beer garden.  I just came by to have a drink, so I haven't had the chance to sample their food (although I've heard good things from friends).  Drinks menu is quite varied, with different ales and international beers.  I particularly loved the atmosphere though---the interior is made of dark wood, which gives a slightly shadowy, intimate feel.  They also have these tiny little doorways you can walk through---it really feels like a small, old British pub.  I love it.  Probably my favourite pub around the area.  Next time, I will have to try their food!

Qww975C7CVbdfdghrPfeow.text: Today, me and a group of friends (6 of us) met up at the Windsor Castle for brunch / Sunday Roast.The pub is very cool and the outdoor space is great.  The staff is very friendly and make every effort to accommodate it patrons and provide service with a smile.  However, they are understaffed and do not appear capable of handling the number of tables that they have on a nice London day.It took over an hour for our food to be served and then only half the dishes were served.  Then it took another 20 minutes to get the other three dishes.  Overall, the roasts were good and the burgers OK, but nothing special and certainly not worth the wait.For a pint, I'll return, but definitely not for the food.

A4_s6Yaf4DaoDF35mbt5Yw.text: I LOVE this pub!!!You want more info than that? oh, ok, I'll see what I can do to convince you that you should love it too.1. Big beer garden that is walled and secluded, the perfect place to be in Summer2. Tiny doors between pub areas - no idea what they are or why they are so small (someone please enlighten me) but you have to literally bend down and almost crawl through them to make it from one part of the pub to the other. Random, interesting, dangerous when drunk, all of the above3. Not on a high street - situated between Notting Hill Gate and High Street Ken, is far enough from each to avoid passing traffic, so people come here because they love it and respect it3 solid reasons should do. Oh, but service is rarely speedy at the bar, so anticipate your thirst, get in there before you are overly parched and get in line.

Q0WQJsym-2R34T71hXk8Tg.text: Fabulous fish and chips, smashing bangers and mash and extra tasty beer. Hate this place.

wrc9P_0YpsCz4sF4aiUM5Q.text: I feel like I'm entering a hobbit dwelling when I duck under those little doorways.The food is pub-adequate, but the real reason to join the 100 other people crowded in here on any given night, is the ambiance.Summer benefits:-open doors, drinking outside for some airWinter benefits:-crowds = body warmth = not being freezing-you literally bump into everyone there...so....hi new friends-mulled wine or hot cider, or better yet a Hot Sailor Jerry which is mulled wine + rum and definitely helps with the warm + drunk goalBeer selection is fine, maybe around 5-10 beers on tap plus a cider or 2. Wine available as well.

e3XxW0S2A6wHiAde4x3-Bg.text: Thanks yelp reviews! Loved it, traditional pub built in 1835. Get the mushroom toast,  sausages + pea mash,  and sticky toffee pudding + pump beer. Can't go wrong! Great, casual atmosphere.  Went alone on work trip but my wife would've loved it!

xDMi8fJWKVzjAbDISBF6xg.text: I'm grateful for a  pub that knows how to be a pub! On a cold last day of the year we walked in here cause of all of the great reviews on Yelp, and were pleasantly surprised!Very cozy, great service, good selection of beer, and the fish and chips......AWESOME!!  Fresh flaky fish with the skin still attached, chips were fried up just right, and the tartar sauce and mushy peas were fantastic as well!I'm so recommending this place to family and friends, and we'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Windsor Castle - London, United Kingdom

Wg9IHbmaqNBkxjjZsm6ncQ.text: Before I begin, I must admit that I am cheerfully awarding a fifth star for the fact that this pub doesn't have a television and they resolutely refuse to acknowledge the existence of any sport.  THANK YOU WINDSOR CASTLE.  If I wanted to watch the football, I'd go to one of those hideous bars with flatscreens and sticky tables and WKD.  But I don't.  I hate sport.  Why does everyone assume that the lives of all 70 million Brits are directly affected by a bit of pigskin being kicked around a field?  NAFF OFF EURO 2012.  I just want to sit and chat with my friends - you know, like we used to do in the olden days before Twitter stopped us being able to communicate in sentences longer than 160 characters.There are no machines to play Who Wants To Be A Millionaire here . . . no loyalty cards or DJs or karaoke nights or surround sound . . .  It's just an old-fashioned pub with mullioned windows and climbing roses that somehow manages to escape both the nearby tourist trade and the "old man" label and remain a warm, atmospheric, characterful gem.  Nicely weathered, with low ceilings, mismatched heavy wooden chairs, benches inscribed with Latin phrases (possibly not authentic), separate bars (originally for segregation between the sexes and classes; now just a leftover quirk) and those wonderful teeny tiny doors through which to clamber en route to the loos.In a disgustingly uncharacteristic twist of fate, I was off the booze the day that we were there, and so I can't comment on the alcoholic drinks available.  (I can say that their diet coke was appropriately fizzy and came with ice and slice. It was an excellent vintage).  However, my friends seemed very happy with a range of beers, both bottled and on tap; I caught the whiff of a particularly delicious bitter; and there was even the odd wine glass scattered throughout, with no complaints to be heard.  The food was very good - perhaps not the best pub lunch ever, but really very good - and above everything else, the staff were absolutely lovely.  In fact as our party grew throughout the course of the afternoon, we moved locations three times without a single complaint, despite the complication of shifting our tab as we went.Such is the charm of this place; you only mean to spend a couple of hours and then the whole day has gone and you don't even realise.  I'm told that there's a delightful beer garden (somebody mentioned tortoises; is this true?!) but the weather was royally crap so we never had the chance to check it out.  Oh well, I guess I'll have to go back again.  Sometimes life is just too tough for words.

photos.caption: Photo of The Windsor Castle - London, United Kingdom. Notice outside, July 2012. Much love to the landlord who is clearly as sick of sport as I am.

NpG5qi6hRUpHJYKQtk0O_A.text: The atmosphere was second only to the food! We had the Scotch Egg for an appetizer. It was amazing! My wife had the steak sandwich, my niece had the fish and chips, my kids both had burgers, and I had the exquisite sausage and mash. We were all extremely impressed.

V5rQm83xoSZD90W93fgg_A.text: Had my first roast there earlier and it was delish! I had the beef and my bestie had the chicken. Both were excellently prepared and presented. I also had the strawberry beer, a glass of Stone's ginger wine and the sticky toffee pudding, all of which were super tasty.The space is cute and cozy. Highly recommended for a dinner spot with a English flair. Really enjoyed it!

s1FbiIVz7RJ_Q0ncUcWDyg.text: How many nights after work did I either sip a conversational adult bevie with friends and co-workers or get completely wankered at the Windsor Castle I cannot remember.I can tell you that inside is a tight, warm, cozy little pub that serves a great pint.I can still remember standing on Kensington Church Street at the entrance to Campden Hill Road, listening for the din of the patrons spilling out into the street and yammering away in drunken and not-so-drunken revery.Ah, God bless The Windsor Castle and all those lucky enough to live near enough to belly up to that particular bar.

CzT-ERJyQ-cl_taywhqg-w.text: We loved this pub.  It was quite fun.  As other reviewers have mentioned, lots of dark wood, tiny doors you have to step through, etc.  Lots of character.   They even have a heated back patio, which is where we found seating, as the pub was quite full and lively.   Definitely a place to go if you are looking for neighborhood pub.

l_dNhgAFaNKHMVPAkSSmBA.text: This place is so quaint, and just what I was looking for in a typical-but-special London pub. Staff are friendly and sincere, interior is cute and cozy, and the bar offers a decent variety of liquor, beer and more (although I was disappointed they only had one type of tequila - and it was Cuervo, of all things - Ick!). However, and this is an enormous "however," their food made me so ill. I ordered the Chicken Hotpot off their dinner menu, & before I had eaten half of it, my stomach was cramping. After 15 more minutes, I was breaking out in hot sweats and suffering from contractions. How on earth would I make it home? ...Somehow I did. And I spent the rest of the night on the shitter. True story. I might go back for a drink, but you can bet your ass I'll never touch the food there again. If it goes out faster than it went in, who knows how it was handled back in that kitchen. Plus, at £32 for two dishes, that's quite pricey for pub food. No. Thanks.

Qs1-GGnVX-3yrqIP6InUGQ.text: Ok, so since I'm not living in the UK anymore I'm a little out of touch with the pub culture & food. However, after entering chain pub after chain pub in London, I was beginning to think that pubs had been taken over in secret by evil McDonalds bodysnatchers.  I'm sure these  chain pubs get the job done if you're from another country and don't know how pubs really should be. Needless to say, I was ecstatic to find this refreshing little pub serving excellent  food and interesting drinks. A far cry from the chain pubs, this is what I remembered an excellent Sunday roast should be!!!! The staff was friendly,  the Stilton mushrooms were practically a religious experience when paired with the Timothy Taylor Landlord, and the Yorkshire pudding was the size of my head! I am only here for just over a week but this warranted 2 visits as the food , drink , and ambience are that good..

hgdMoezxO0586AypIhE41w.text: The fifth star is for the tiny doors separating the different sections of the pub. The fourth star is for the awesome hidden away but large garden area, complete with the winter essentials, covered canopies and heat lamps.Kind of out of the way but will definitely come back again when visiting my nearby buddies.

hqkbjH5RatkIp_PAhsqssg.text: Have come here twice, once to meet two friends for drinks and the other for a birthday party.  The patio/beer garden is perfect - lots of shaded trees and umbrellas in case it rains.  Love it.  I also love the Tudor interior and exterior.  Making reservations is a good idea.  For the birthday party they reserved a whole section in the patio for us which was really nice.  However, I have to say that you only really want to come here for a beer.  The food is okay but not wonderful, and don't ask for a shot of anything!  (it comes in a glass mug)  We also asked for some plates for some cake but they were kind of dirty (one had mustard on it still, and another with some other substance) and the request was greeted with shock (!). Otherwise - the staff are all pretty nice and food is decently priced.  For a summer day, this place probably can't be beat - but this is not a gastro pub by any means.

wnzOU1REKhFd8EDQoayVqQ.text: I always like to try local places. I went on Sunday and got mixed roast. It was delicious. Combined with great selection of beers, it made it into a very nice dinner experience.

QOiKu-q-LJEL6TFTY2elDg.text: Super cool pub. I love love love the little doors and the little sections. Felt kind of like Alice in Wonderland. Came here for a Sunday roast after walking through Kensington. It was a bit crowded in the first couple rooms; however, after wandering through a few tiny tiny doors, I found a great spot to camp out. My mom had the pork and I had the roast beef. They were both fabulous. If we weren't in a rush, I would have started a tab and had some pudding and maybe hung out a bit longer since the service was so friendly, but unfortunately, we had to hurry. Will be back next time for another great roast.

photos.caption: Photo of The Windsor Castle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Windsor Castle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Windsor Castle - London, United Kingdom

ryTsp68eCdOrKVIrm6PpAQ.text: This place just gets better and better!I'd only been during winter, fearful that they were a one-trick-log-fire-hot-cider pony. But with a hidden, beautiful beer garden at the back, The Windsor Castle stays at number 1 for my favourite pubs in London.

M6vWnz8cc-_S5lYBH6bC5w.text: Decent enough pub, the staff aren't terrible but usually don't have any knowledge of the pint they are pulling. There is def. the sense of quick rotating bar staff. Slightly on the expensive side as well. On the other hand the atmosphere maybe on the sterile side but you can tell that it used to be a grand old pub. It also has a lovely garden and it is as good as it gets if your looking for a pint in that area.

0L5rq62uu5m2lC9yn1pEFQ.text: Good food especially the fish, great atmosphere, great location, friendly service. Overall  a really nice place to go out.

mVpPFmuvqLOoWqVX3AFX5A.text: I stopped in for a pint as this is in my neighborhood.  Quite cozy spot, kind bar maids, good vibe.  As a American guest I found this to be exactly what I'd think a English pub would be.  Going back to try a bite to eat before returning home.  By the was they served me a lovely Belgium beer!

nNIaam7Imsaw1fb4AGCCZA.text: This gastropub has a secret garden in the back that traps the sun, making it the perfect post-Holland park hideaway.We both ordered the fish and chips, which I seriously think is the best I've had in London. Everything was fresh and well presented.For dessert I had the sticky toffee pudding, which again was delicious and very moist. It also came smothered in toffee sauce with a huge scoop of ice cream, it was the perfect finish to my meal.

photos.caption: Photo of The Windsor Castle - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips

iSS-eQCfi9FhbxjZ1gBpsQ.text: Probably we are "spoilt" but look - once you've seen the inside of a few other establishments in the area, you'll likely agree this place leaves you feeling a bit, well, scummy.  It is a shame, because the folks serving the pints are really friendly, and the sort you almost want to come back for just to chat up.  Then you recall the musty olfactory overload and remind yourself you might just call up the staff and offer to buy them a cheaper pint elsewhere.  Three stars-one in honor of each member of the staff behind the bar-cheers to them!*Accidentally "checked in" twice...believe us, once was quite enough.

sToH2Hym691joH7G5vYa4g.text: Stopped here for an early dinner and we weren't disappointed. Scotch egg was good, burgers were okay and beer was (finally) cold. We've struggled to find cold beer:) The atmosphere was charming! Restrooms were very clean.

yUXGJjDat-4WqK1vN6Popw.text: Phenomenal atmosphere.Excellent food.Wonderful staff.The manager was a prince.We ate there last night.We plan a return visit - tomorrow evening.Five stars tells it all; and no, I don't make a habit of handing out five stars.

photos.caption: Photo of The Windsor Castle - London, United Kingdom. Two absolutely awesome dishes!!!

hycyyX7Vx46k5n_S78syVQ.text: TL;DR: great food, fine selection of beer and wine, interesting building.We took our son here when we visited London based on the Yelp reviews, and were not disappointed. We ended up in what was pretty much a chambre separée, a little alcove with a couch that must have been custom built for it, but the waiting staff stopped by regularly anyway, and one of the bars was just in the next room over. Prices were normal by London standards (i.e., not exactly cheap). Worth a visit.

TZd8j1nsEPIisePryERqpg.text: I came here a few days ago and l absolutely loved it. The place is well decorated and gives a very historic feel. Especially when entering a new room since you must duck through a tiny door. The menu has plenty of options.  We with the bone marrow burger. It was delicious and my friend got the lamb. The lamb was so soft and tender full of flavor.  I thought it was really cool how everything on the menu had a recommended beer to go with. I would recommend to anyone.On a separate note. Does anyone know if this place is haunted? I went to the bathroom and I had I feeling someone was watching me. I turned around and I swear I saw a white mist. I ran my ass out amd yelled. Now I'm thinking maybe it was my imagination but who knows... super fucking creepy lol

photos.caption: Photo of The Windsor Castle - London, United Kingdom

GotqlfLNYKN4ToDJcH0muQ.text: When I travel, I like to go to places that are seemingly filled with more locals. This place would be it. It's charming, dark, intimate, but loud all in one. Every characteristic of the pub, from the interior decor to the selection of draft beers make it worth the travel.  It get's filled, and I recommend a reservation if you want to eat- which by the way you should. The burger was delicious, so were the fish and chips ( we ordered two rounds), and the sausage had so much flavor.Next time I'm back in London I'll be sure to pay this place another visit, as it tr

8G9l2XGAgYt3JfA9HiqIAA.text: Good food at hard-to-beat prices with a charming atmosphere. Service less than stellar at times. Pro:Amazing bangers and mashHuge and awesome outdoor areaBecause it's tucked away in a residential area, it doesn't get crazy busyCool, rustic vibe to the interiorMains for under 10 poundsCon:The service can be pretty slow

3NA4Ome9eHTQ1RYCeU02tA.text: My husband and I came here last night for dinner and a few beers and it was perfect. I'm lactose intolerant and the staff was SUPER accommodating and friendly. The atmosphere was fun and perfect for those in their 20s or 30s like us. We had a great time and the food was delicious. My husband had bangers and mash and I had a burger.

rKLVEf3vCET_puc_pGA7Sg.text: A bit disappointed about this place after seeing all the raving reviews. We got a mixed pork and sirloin roast plate, and chicken and ham hock pie. The portions were quite small for the price and the food wasn't that impressive: the pork was on the dry side, I found maybe one piece of ham in my hock pie, and kale without dressing was served in place of salad. The best part of that meal was perhaps the roasted carrots, which were very sweet, almost like sweet potatoes. Overall I would not recommend.

fHbq83F4oFGl6H0E1JnXfA.text: Their website says that in the late 1830s, the classes and sexes were segregated at this pub.  Today, they bill themselves as "Kensington's friendliest pub" offering a "welcoming and relaxed atmosphere."  Ironically, this is where we experienced the least friendly service during our stay in London.We came on a Sunday, but opted not to have their lavish Sunday roast.  While perusing our menus, the server came by and told us we had to PAY IN ADVANCE.  That was a first and only on our trip.  Maybe it's a pub thing.  He took our drink orders and when we said we would be having dinner, he said we could pay after we got our beers, but before the food came out.  He got impatient with us as we attempted to count our coins in the dark, finally reaching over and counting it out for me.Anyhow, we both had the LANDMARK.  An excellent beer by the way.  Highly recommend.  We both also wanted the fish and chips, but they were out by the time we came by for an early dinner, so we ordered the BURGER, a thick, juicy West Country beef patty with cheddar and smoked bacon and served with fries.  It was fantastic that day!  Right up there with the best burgers I've ever had.So we definitely enjoyed our beer and food.  But we saw and experienced none of the friendliness.  In fact, while we were waiting for our food, the same server argued with the customers at the next table and after another server brought out the wrong dishes to us (and we mistakenly accepted them), she gave us a nasty look when we flagged her down to come back for the dishes.So get your money ready and keep your head down.

3_WoUYj4CVlVnEtVGL5C4g.text: Bread, true English chips, artichokes, peppers, cheese plate -- all fabulous. Poor Katy who is putting us up for two weeks just down the street tried to order me a Manhattan at my bequest and was told "we don't have Manhattan's here, love!" I felt bad as she's a regular! Fabulous place to people watch, cat watch (Odie the cat hopped up on the chair next to me and bit my finger softly whilst Patrick took our picture), and great for two year olds like Katy and James' adorable poppet, Arlo. Service was a tad slow, but it was a Friday night so I'm not holding it against them too much. We'll def be back for a good English whisky!

4SLNpdA0bvz9zlh0BgxamA.text: Let me set the scene:It was another cold day in London, I'd spent an hour in Westfield looking at stuff I didn't want to buy and was walking to a Japanese Garden that I'd heard about in Holland Park.I found the Japanese Garden which was Japanese in the sense there was a small pond and I spotted one koi in there, but afterwards while lost and trying to find the station (damn you Googlemaps), I had a hankering for a quiet pint in a quaint pub and walked in.There was a good selections of beers, and I was able to try some out before deciding on one (I love it when pubs let you do that). Being that it was Good Friday I had seen a load of signs advertising fish'n'chips so *obviously* at the first rumble (read: full blown tremor), I ordered a plate. I actually thought the food was pretty good so quite happily spent a couple of hours here chillin' in the warmth. OK, I think I am officially old.:)

RCetCvF7uu5vKyoHOyvhXA.text: I ordered the Fish & Chips with a pint of Timothy Taylor's. The degree of freshness was obvious. The fish had all of the components of a cooked fish and was not some manufactured piece of processed materials. Fresh cut fries with the potato skins still on. And the mashed peas still consisted of whole piece indicating that they were mashed at the venue.  When the dish was brought out to me it was so hot that it required tartar sauce to avoid burning myself; waiting was not a rational option. Timothy Taylor's complement the dish well.In terms of atmosphere, this place is the epitome of cozy. Small and dimly lit with low arching overhangs forcing you to duck down. Also, the Windsor Castles fills up pretty quickly; I saw quite a few people making rounds looking for a table.

XMUxZHLOYwTGXb_o9ydKmg.text: Lovely old pub with great choice of gins with my favourite fever tree tonic , bar staff friendly and atmosphere great. Had a meal which was ok though our waiter was a bit random, seemed surprised when we asked for a bucket to keep our white wine cold, also had to walk round the place to find him to order a drink and when we asked for a list of liqueurs / shots he said there wasn't a list!!

XWSInaMWLtZkoue9LoJ0bw.text: My husband and I came here to have dinner and drinks because of the favorable reviews.  I ordered the smoked chicken, avocado and bacon salad with Caesar dressing.  When I finally received my plate, I found the avocado completely inedible as it was rock hard and brown in color.  The iceberg lettuce was not crisp but rather mushy and gross.  The so called wait staff were apparently attentive to the regulars and locals, however, not so much to us.  When I mentioned to the server how my meal was inedible, I felt my concerns were completely dismissed and not even acknowledged.  I am not one to complain about poor service or food but this experience has truly been the WORST EXPERIENCE EVER!!!

EoHMBXlE2bCkyzW-zGdF0g.text: This is the pub that you imagine finding but rarely do.Usually the best pubs in town are off the main drag, this one is too.Located in the middle of residential streets in Kensington, the Windsor Castle is immediately appealing. Inside there is a small warren of little rooms with dark wood panels and low ceilings and small doors that separate the different sections. There are separate doors on the outside to each section too. I think in the past these compartments were there to separate the riff-raff  from the more genteel classes!Good selection of beers on tap and the food is great too. Pub food done well and served well. On the last visit we enjoyed some great sausage and mash and steamed pud.Bonus is quite a sizeable beer garden at the back but it's inevitably packed, especially if the weather is good as well as the pub itself since the secret  place is already out but I still like to visit if I am in the area.

Mp-jcfACxh4Dgr7cOiBoJw.text: Huge portions, genuine feel but not exceptional food and somewhat let down by the lack of service. If you are a large crowd and intend to hunker down for afternoon drinks, happy to wait 40 minutes for the food, then get involved.

photos.caption: Photo of The Windsor Castle - London, United Kingdom. Upstairs
Photo of The Windsor Castle - London, United Kingdom. The pork was good, no apple sauce though.
Photo of The Windsor Castle - London, United Kingdom. Yorkshire pudding was a little dry for my liking.

URaYUm-8Fzl3BolvdzLDPQ.text: Such a charming pub.  Can only comment on the atmosphere and drinks as we didn't get any food. Inside is so quaint with really cute little doors you have to duck through to get to other parts of the pub.  Out back is the most beautiful garden. On a warm evening its so inviting to sit out under the greenery with the twinkling lights.  So perfect for an after dinner drink!

cN20xRtxiGj7ynoukkqlWg.text: As a young lad from the U.S, I've had my fair share of burgers. Seeing one on the menu I thought I'd give it a try and see what the Brits had to offer. To my dismay, it was simply the worst and most nasty burger I had ever had. I would liken it to taking a hefty bite right out of the rear end of a cow with a fresh case of mad cow disease. Great beer though.

JXwt9EEHyNg9YGW0eZLSxA.text: Man, I wish we had a place like this in Texas, but it wouldn't be the same. We were in London for five days and came here every evening. The first two nights we came for drinks and had a blast. On a Saturday afternoon we had the pleasure of sitting outside. It was truly like being around your friends and having a great time. We even saw a British celebrity there with his friends and family.Sunday we came back for the roast and it was unbelievable. My only wish was that I had brought my phone to take photos. Best pub food we had in London. If you are in Kensington make time to drop by The Windsor Castle. It provided a heck of a good time.

DDFQTFH8z5Na5ACMtMmNaA.text: This place is the best! I only went here for a drink, so I don't know about the food at all. I only know that is supposed to be good. The ginger ale is good! The atmosphere is amazing as well! The comfort is GREAT, and I MEAN GREAT. There is nothing like it! The charming tiny doors are cool also, The Price is cheap. The service is average, not that special, and not that bad! So, with all that said, this place is recommended, hopefully it is recommended on ZAGAT also!

photos.caption: Photo of The Windsor Castle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Windsor Castle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Windsor Castle - London, United Kingdom. The outside space in Windsor castle pub

LTQmOhYsskwghq1iuTsmqg.text: Tasty dinner in Kensington. The neighborhood is a nice area. The place can get extremely busy on a Friday night. Most tables after 8pm were reserved. They had a pretty good selection of cask ales and the food was really tasty. I had the fish and chips. The fish was quality fish and the chips were really tasty. My sister had the sausage with mashed potatoes and gravy. It was also really good. They had us order from a server but then never checked back on us again, it was hard to get anything else. It's like they have table service but then don't actually do it. It's a good stop with good food.

photos.caption: Photo of The Windsor Castle - London, United Kingdom. Fish & chips
Photo of The Windsor Castle - London, United Kingdom. Sausage
Photo of The Windsor Castle - London, United Kingdom

KQrLy12Qh5Oe5zmhKza6CA.text: Love this pub!!! Tucked away in a wonderful residential neighborhood. You must sit out back on a nice day. The staff is awesome, Very friendly and hard working. Fish and Chips are average but the risotto was awesome. You really are there for the atmosphere, so relax and enjoy

photos.caption: Photo of The Windsor Castle - London, United Kingdom. Dine under this gorgeous tree
Photo of The Windsor Castle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Windsor Castle - London, United Kingdom. Hope we left quietly

uCLrzUv5xWMJALUSUaU6Cw.text: Surprised by the food chicken Caesar salad!  Fish and chips were a tad oily for our tastes very quaint inside

photos.caption: Photo of The Windsor Castle - London, United Kingdom

dEKN_MD0Ctq-LYvSroNdbg.text: It's nice to have some local pubs that are just reliable and reliably good.  Like the Windsor Castle, a Notting Hill institution that just delivers.I realised I hadn't been for a fair few years when I spotted a few subtle changes.  At first sight everything was just like I remembered it - the walled beer garden, the wood panelled bars separated into cosy bars, the large selection of interesting beers, the bangers and mash on the menu - but the kitchen has moved to make room for a large dining area at the back of the pub, the toilets relocated to the first floor.  Still, everything feels as if it's always been like this - a very gentle upgrade and obviously in keeping with the pub's listed status.The only thing that was new to me was the lack of customers.  Perhaps not surprisingly on a Monday evening, but I've never seen the Windsor Castle so empty!  Let's hope this was just a fluke and next time I visit it will be buzzing again.

HhUHxWDNQSZiI-AZonp7xw.text: So this place is away from all the hustle & bustle & tourists in central London. It took us sometimes to find it actually & we got there 3 ish on a Sunday. The first impression when we walked in was not the best, it was like we are invisible, so many staff walked pass by us without acknowledging or even looking at us. It felt like we are invisible :)In the end I decided to go inside to approach ( basically block their way from running) one of the waiters & ask if they got any table available & my husband waited at the bar behind 4,5 others to be served. So when I finally could get attention of one of the waiters( and I can tell you it wasn't easy) he said that the food has to be ordered at the bar) so I went running back to the bar & it was finally our turn but then he said that they are pretty much out of everything specially Sunday's roast ( which was the reason we went there) & the waiting time is up to one hour so we just left & didnt even finish our drink which we sort of were too rushed to order & the really unpleasant unfriendly guy at the bar just wanted to keep the flow moving, I mean he didn't even give us a menu & he wanted us to order something else instead!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Windsor Castle - London, United Kingdom

-aSbLWTFaKnHlJlMATqq1Q.text: Good food here - came here for the fish and chips and was not disappointed. My fiancee got the cheeseburger and enjoyed it as well.Found that the customer service here was very casual. It wasn't bad, but, no one directed us where to sit when we came in. We roamed around for several minutes while several employees (we later learned, because, they don't wear uniforms) buzzed passed us. It wasn't until I randomly asked one, thinking they were a patron, where the host was, that they revealed they indeed worked there and it was just self-seating. No one was rude per se, just seemed rather disinterested in actually getting people served quickly/efficiently. Not sure if this is a typical pub experience or not.

5BARhSwvIM0ZNWynL42tlw.text: The Windsor Castle has gone way downhill over the past few years. It's still a cozy little boozer if you can manage to wrangle a drink and a seat, but the staff barely speak English and have only the most rudimentary bar skills. Every request for a pint was met with "Eh?" and every pint I was served was different from the last one. We asked the waitress, also foreign, if we could order some chips and she replied "I think those are done" and walked off with the menu. Just terrible. It's so disappointing to see a good pub become a victim of its successes.

f6-6EoQvMFYxmlivM_dAQg.text: Set in close proximity to Notting Hill and Kensington in the Holland Park neighborhood, The Windsor Castle Pub might very well deserve a boast as one of the top best food pubs in central London. Food wise, note their menu changes seasonally; here are some favs from Summer 2014: pork-apple bangers on caramelized onion-fig polenta, braised scallops with lardon, smoked Haddock fish pie, toffee crunch cheese cake, sticky-toffee pudding - just a few of the addictions you'll find here.Our server was outwardly friendly and helpful (even by American standards), the menu proved to be both varied and generous in proportions. The crowd is what I would deem as being posh, but not aloof nor alienating. Back garden-courtyard is quaint, intimate and fully green...overflowing with grape vines and tall Horse Chestnut trees (mind your noggin during 'conker' season). All in all, an English charm well worth placing somewhere on your list of pubs to visit. If I were local, I imagine this being my Sunday roast supper terminus.Besides, anywhere that's adjacent to a Peel Street (a la 'Emma') get tops scores from me.

photos.caption: Photo of The Windsor Castle - London, United Kingdom. "It was a dark, wet and stormy night - so we got right to drinkin'."
Photo of The Windsor Castle - London, United Kingdom. Braised scallops with lardon.
Photo of The Windsor Castle - London, United Kingdom. Apple cider bangers on caramelized onion polenta.

zV46aRIRQVtI6_txB-r2OQ.text: Since Churchill Arms was packed, we walked up the street to find a place to sit down and have a pint (or rather, several) to chat with a friend.We went to the back of the pub where it was less crowded so that we could hear each other in conversation. Service was fast and efficient to crank out pint after pint for thirsty customers.It wasn't as pretty as The Churchill Arms but definitely a solid pub to go to with better service and friendlier atmosphere.

dbCrqERYsYr7MJVl6v1sZw.text: I'm currently writing this review from the US embassy where my family and I are replacing the passports we had stolen along with my purse, wallet, credit cards, cell phone and charmingly.... both my coat and my son's coat on a 40 degree day!This "lovely" pub in Kensington is clearly in on a theft ring in the area for the following reasons:First- we had a reservation and as we walked in the bartender and waitress looked at each other and "decided" to move us from our reserved table to a table in a side room..... Shockingly this room has NO CCTV access!Second our teenage children watched a couple move from table to table in this pub, highly suspiciously, from the front of the pub to our room, never ordering food or drink.... then this couple took up the table directly behind us. My son actually mentioned that the strange man motioned to the waitress right before he got up to leave but never ordered anything.... And guess what? Within 5 minutes we realized my purse with everything we needed for our trip was gone!And alas....you'd think our waitress would be distressed, falling all over to help us correct??? Nope, we found her drinking beer at the bar!The "managers" let us into their office to spend an hour: calling the USELESS local police (they won't come to do anything btw), canceling our credit cards etc. Then, the Pub "generously" called us a free Uber (please read with sarcasm).Last but not least in line this morning at the embassy we met a lovely American girl who had the exact same thing happen on the same day down the street at Churchill Arms in Kensington- so a huge shout out to our fabulous British hosts for being either crooks or f*cking oblivious to a crime ring running in their locals.And lest you think we are "stupid Americans" this is our third trip to London (and our last!) we have traveled all over Europe, Asia, North America, Central America and Caribbean and this has been by far our worst experience traveling.

ErEq2Q6taq7L3rjXlcnV9A.text: We came in on a Friday night, fairly early around 7pm, to enjoy a pub dinner while visiting London for the first time. We choose this place due to the proximity of our hotel, being on multiple lists for a top pub in London and overall pretty good reviews. We were quite turned off at first, but the night turned around. We walked into to the bar area and realized the restaurant is quite sectioned off without a good hostess stand. All of the tables had a "reserved at Xpm" marker on them. Most of the tables weren't even coming in till 9pm or after and when asked for a place to sit, the bartenders/servers said they had nothing available. We thought that was quite odd to hold over 50% of your tables that were empty when you could have just asked us to be off that table within 2 hours. We decided to head to the back open beer garden area to see about food and drinks there. We secured a table, but we realized there isn't a service out there. You have to walk in to the bar to order drinks or food so it would be quite annoying/tedious fighting your way through a crowd just to order a drink. Additionally, we wanted food and so many people were smoking outside we almost just gave up and left. After being quite discouraged, we decided to try and just sit at one of the tables who weren't coming in until 9pm anyways. It was a success! We ordered food and drinks at the bar and sat the rest of the night at the 'reserved' table without any issues. The food was surprisingly yummy and we let satisfied. We ordered the scotch eggs to start, and they were probably some of the best ones we had during our trip to London. Crispy and hot on the outside, but moist and slightly runny egg on the inside. Next we got the bangers and mash and steak sandwich. The bangers were really good. Salt was right, sausage was juicy but crisp and the sauce was quite delicious. The steak sandwich was 'just alright'. Tip: Get reservations or sit at a table marked 'reserved' where you have time to get in/out before the party arrives.

photos.caption: Photo of The Windsor Castle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Windsor Castle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Windsor Castle - London, United Kingdom

hnffxO6aqIREDZbwxusElQ.text: A great neighborhood pub! We were visiting from out of town and this was near our hotel. Great selection of beers, cask and draft... A beautiful, historic building with old style decor... And a friendly staff to top it all off. There's also a beautiful courtyard with outdoor seating. We had a great time.They were out of several items we had ordered which was a little frustrating but the bartender was able to recommend suitable alternatives.

photos.caption: Photo of The Windsor Castle - London, United Kingdom

kuPrKGOEqQ373Ys-CXUc3A.text: Dear Fellow ForeignersDisclaimer: This visit was on our first night in London, with the stereotypically absent understanding of British pub culture.The vibe here was unreal.  People were laughing, cheering, and clearly having a good time.  When I asked the bartender if we just seat ourselves, she just said, "Good luck."  She was right.  There is a great beer garden in the back, and ample seating up front.  It is just a very popular place, and there were a few meet-ups going on.  It was about 30 minutes before a table opened up, but we were able to order drinks and roam freely with them until a table opened up.  By the time a table opened up in the bar area, we clumsily heel-toed our way towards it.It took another 20 minutes before I realized I had to go to the bar to order the food (read disclaimer above). The short of it is that the beers and the bartenders were great. I did not recognize one beer on their menu, which allowed me to explore a bunch of different varieties.  I told them the qualities I look for in a beer, and they matched it up perfectly.  They really do know their ales.The food...well, I don't know if pubs are one of those places you shouldn't typically order food at, but we did.  I got a beef sandwich with fries and my wife got a burger.  The sandwich wasn't bad, but the burger was dry, dry, dry.  "Well done" was an understatement.However, color me charmed!  We quickly got on with drinking the night away.  Overall, this is a visit I will make again.  It was hugely responsible for helping us understand and appreciate pub culture.  I would recommend it as a first stop for anyone staying in the Kensington area (or thereabouts) if you want a crash course in pub culture.  You won't feel alienated, but you also won't feel immersed in a pool of fellow travelers dampening the authenticity of this place.  Plus, the drinks are great and the bartenders know their stuff.  Going back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of The Windsor Castle - London, United Kingdom. I heart real ales now, too!

9ry96pCFmc5nIQBBpi99Kw.text: I love English pub culture and this place certainly instills all those cultural qualities. A banging Sunday roast with ALL the trimmings, an excellent real ale line up (and beer in general really), a great boozer garden, wooden quirky interior that hasn't been meddled with too much over the past 100 (+??) years and some great gins. If you committed to trying all of the beers that they have on tap you would need to be carried out of the place. On top of the real ales they have a broad selection of English craft beers, big name brands and international crafties. The wine list could do with a bit of work.There is lots and lots of tables in the booze garden but as soon as the sun is out it does fill up pretty quickly after work and on Sundays. To be expected! Inside there are these small hobbit like doors that you have to duck through and lots of pokey corners to nestle into and enjoy your beer/roast/gin. As I said, it just feels really English. All the food is great but if you're there on a Sunday I would highly recommend the roast. A good place for sharing other menu items too and good gourmet snacks rotate through the menu such as terrine and mussels.

photos.caption: Photo of The Windsor Castle - London, United Kingdom. Amazing.

wmWCo9geCUHPpJf5ZXtuHw.text: AVOID! LOUSY RUDE somewhat-discriminatory bartenders who can't get an order right in English! (Pub seems to be a hotspot for pick-pockets who may be in cahoots with the barstaff. Read review below by another Yelper on this.)Not sure if service had to do with the fact that most of the people in our group were not white. Would like to think not, but we felt judged - you can see such things in people's eyes. Aspects of how were addressed made me wonder if the barstaff's manners were a function of whatever impolite, uncouth, diversity-lacking country they hailed from!Perhaps the pub has new owners now. I used to live 2 blocks away and this used to be a decent neighborhood gastropub. But now, it's the worst pub ever - spoilt my afternoon out with friends, embarrassing me in the process, as I had vouched for the place.Took 30 mins to get drinks and place an order for food. The bar tender who took my order could not speak English to save her life. She screwed up the order, most of which were burgers with slight variations on the theme. Had to repeat myself 5 times.Furthermore, one of my friends there with me is pregnant and needed to know if some of the food ingredients would be ok for her. They were completely callous about taking her order and understanding what she could or couldn't eat (rare meat, unpasteurized cheese). She ordered a non-alcoholic drink (a cordial) which they basically served without any cordial in it, just soda water. When she complained that it tasted like soda water, another rude, snooty, French bartender said "so what's the problem? It's non-alcoholic". Same snooty bartender had no problem flirting with other customers who cut in line, while ignoring us as we ordered drinks.It took more than an hour and 15 mins to get us the food. They kept saying "5-10 more minutes" but no food appeared. And finally the rude Frenchwoman said, "like I said, you'll get the food when the kitchen has cooked it". Completely ridiculous! We eventually cancelled our order and left. What is clear is that their waitstaff, who couldn't speak a lick of English or didn't have the decency to understand our order and pay attention to it, are the rudest bar staff I've encountered in all of Kensington, having lived there for years. Spoilt our evening, not to mention that they didn't give a damn about a pregnant person in our group, who clearly needed to stay on a dietary schedule with some restrictions.I will never go back and will make sure all my friends in the neighborhood hear of this.

pVe1rKOLj5PBHFwQyKT7WA.text: Had a wonderful meal - deep fried calamari followed by venison pie. The wine, the Chilean Pinot Noir was a perfect match. Excellent service in an authentic pub. Perfect!

photos.caption: Photo of The Windsor Castle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Windsor Castle - London, United Kingdom

1kegd0PL8zwnqdzen5Yiyw.text: Pleasant enough slightly cramped pub with a good and continuously changing beer selection. Relatively quiet in the early evenings, but noisy later on. Takes reservations, but we didn't eat there.Dark wood décor, with amusing barriers between the bars where you have to stoop to get through.

T1k6l1ylGgkgCu_RuyrKsg.text: It's a pub so when it's busy you need to be persistent to get service. Lots of regulars who get attention over the occasional customers. The gammon was excellent but my wife (who wrote her own review) was unhappy with her smoked chicken dish that included hard, unripe avocado.

photos.caption: Photo of The Windsor Castle - London, United Kingdom. The bar

v-Vvx1Llyk-4cL9Y3WbFdQ.text: Fell in love with the Windsor Castle Pub, after a lovely autumnal walk around Holland Park. We found this pub on YELP.    Arrived in the pub just after 12 noon, after racing up Camden Hill  Drive in order to avoid the threatening dark clouds of an impending rainstorm. I feared the place might be crammed with locals on a Sunday afternoon. Turns out we just beat the rush, and picked a fun dark booth, near the bar, at the front of the pub. We needn't have worried. It seems most of the locals preferred the lovely garden area  in the rear courtyard, as the sun had returned.      What a fantastic interior! Yes! I can see why Canucks would be enchanted by the very traditional, historic decor... The dark woods, rustic booths, benches and stools...fun tiny doors, to either step through or duck under.... and ever-challenging depending on the number of pints consumed!        We each ordered a pint of 7.3% alcohol organic cider, from the cheerful & friendly staff. It sounded very innocent, but as I reflect back on it, this is basically like ordering a litre of very tasty, very potent, healthy apple juice, that can go down very fast! (By the way, this place has a fantastic selection of ales, ciders, & wines)! Predictably, it didn't take long before the high alcoholic content kicked in and thus more and more giggles  began to emanate from our booth.       Happily, our Sunday roasts arrived soon after (beef for him, chicken for her) so I could have something solid on my stomach.  (I was beginning to wonder if I could even STAGGER back to our flat on Palace Terrace Gardens -I didn't particularly favor giving "The Colonies", a bad reputation.) The roasts  and veg were solid, but nothing spectacular. (Next time I am going to try the highly rated fish and chips!).....However....       the STICKY TOFFEE PUDDING was TO DIE FOR!!!!.... far superior to any other that I have ever sampled in the rest of the galaxy.  Now admittedly, it is pretty hard to dislike sticky toffee pudding. However, we are certified gourmands with regard to this particular food group, and we are one tough lot to impress in this category. We even have our own coveted secret family recipe for sticky toffee pudding - so we do tend to take this dessert VERY seriously.      The pudding at the Windsor Castle Pub, was light, moist, with lots of raisins.The toffee sauce also was light and just the right amount of sweetness. The scoop of REAL vanilla ice cream was the crowning glory.  This was the perfect portion to share with a loved one.    My advice to Frommers: forget recommending the smelly "Churchill Arms", (with it's creepy, dusty, weird memorabilia crammed everywhere and hanging all over the ceiling)... Walk east a couple of blocks and experience a much pleasanter pub atmosphere. Join all those with the  YELP app, who highly rate the "Windsor Castle"!!! I gave this pub a 5 star rating because locals obviously loved it, fantastic authentic decor, cheerful friendly staff, good service, nice food, great selection of ales etc, and one unforgettable Sticky Toffee Pudding! :)

B8vVtX6k0x4aNBW0P-rpiQ.text: Great pub with Timmys on tap. Quite busy most nights.  Excellent outdoor beer garden.  Great for hot evening after work.

D4DUhIughdreiAICIA24EA.text: This is such a lovely little pub!  I wish I had spent more time here.  Its layout is interesting and you may have to dip down to get through some of the doorways but that is what adds to its charm.  Its garden is a great place to go and drink a pint with friends in the summertime.

hptsCqTCDs-lNEsu7kkrCA.text: I have been going to the Windsor Castle since I was a student living in the West End in 1995, and every time I am back in London I specifically make an effort to have a few pints in one of my favourite pubs. For a Yank, The Windsor Castle captures that idealised view of the quintessential British Pub. Dark wood, brass, creaky floors, history, etc., this place has it, but the true bonus is the killer beer garden out back. It is one of the best I've found, and makes for a great location to lazily waste the day and night away. The Sunday Roast is always on point (if they haven't sold out), and the beer and cider selection is excellent. I am predominantly a cask ale drinker, and their selection has always been generous in the bitter department. I know my wife and friend loved the pitcher of Pimm's lemonade which was loaded with cucumber and fruit. Service here has always been above average, and the location is extremely convenient, maybe a 5-10 minute walk from Notting Hill tube stop, and really not that far away from Kensington High Street. Also, this place makes a great stop on a Notting Hill pub crawl as its only a couple blocks up the road from The Hillgate.

-3CMcnz7VoCRpw4iyUvnoA.text: Charming old pub with great beer garden that is quite large. Thought the food was horrible though I tried the nachos and wedges with cheese and bacon. Admittedly not the most gourmet offerings but not great. Stick to drinking here but not eating.

clRZHz0pi73c2elupzOlNg.text: A proper old boozer with a nice garden and tiny doors. Good slection of beers, wine and cider. Average pub grub makes for a great pub. With tiny doors!

w5wRMyMeVF6mn7IFzP06_w.text: Gorgeous olde worlde pub near Notting Hill. Lovely oak interior with open fires plus the pub has loads of history, dating back to Victorian times. It's a really relaxing place for lunch, and makes you feel a world away from the fast pace of London. I've eaten here many times and the food has always been amazing. The fish and chips are to die for. Wine list isn't bad either! I highly recommend it.

S45JNgsVsz-8JUOJeidlgA.text: This place is a tiny tiny pub just a few streets back from Notting Hill which means it is avoided by tourists and visited mainly by locals who live in the surrounding streets. It is a very traditional looking pub and is so small it looks like a miniature. It has two wooden tables outside squished onto the pavement where you can sit in the sun. The inside is dark and gloomy but most comfortable in the winter with a real cosy warm feel.

hrKfuOm5d7s2YGpXIMVflQ.text: Cute interior, although the bright lights can be a bit of a mood killer. Usually a struggle to get a table, so if you are going to be late and sitting is important, forget it. Ciders are good. Avoid the food, spent the next day on the loo :-(
